results.title: How plants feed
results.brief_description: A study of how plants obtain the elements necessary for their existence from the air and from the soil. Microcinematography and animation are used to show how, through their roots and leaves, plants absorb nourishment from the air and the soil, and how crystals are formed in the plant cells from concentrated solutions of certian substances.

results.title: How pine trees reproduce
results.creator_credit: William M. Harlow and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses time lapse and close-up photography to study the processes involved in the reproduction of pine trees - the opening mechanism of pine cones, the fertilization of seed-producing cones by wind-borne pollen from male cones, the dissemination of seeds, and the germination of seeds. Stresses the importance of continuing research to conserve and improve the quality of the pine forests of North America.

results.title: How our two party system operates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr Alfred de Grazia explains the role of political parties in the U.S.A., their history, the structure of the major American political party, voter behaviour, and functions of the parties.

results.title: How much is enough
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with the work of the United Nations Children’s Fund in Africa, the Near East, Pakistan, the Orient and the West Indies. It shows the scope and the type of work done by the organisation which raises money all over the world to help needy children in underdeveloped areas

results.title: How much cooperation?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Office Supervisor’s Problems”.
A discussion-provoking film about employer and employee office cooperation. A supervisor returns from an out of town trip with a rush job. He speaks to the staff about it and promises to have it ready so they won’t have to work back on it.

results.title: How much affection?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and Family Living”.
A social guidance docu-drama promoting restraint against premarital sex. After nearly succumbing to her boyfriend’s advances, teenager Laurie seeks her mother’s advice. Following a sensible discussion with her mother and the lesson provided by her friend Eileen, a victim of her physical urges, Laurie considers the long term consequences of sexual temptation.

results.title: How many members in a set
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Children are presented with a variety of materials through which to learn mathematical concepts. The teacher invites several children to group small toy cars into various sets and endeavours to lead them to the abstract notion of members of a set. From here the film then moves around the class and observes the activities of other children with the material offered them.

results.title: How level is sea level
results.creator_credit: Larry Klingman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Defines mean sea level and explains how it is determined. Describes factors that influence sea level at various locations, and analyses the problems of creating a sea level canal in Central America.

results.title: How its surface changes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
Explains the slow but constant changes in the surface of the earth by showing the erosive effects of water and wind upon a recently excavated mound of raw earth. Includes scenes of the eruption of the Paracutin Volcano, the Grand Canyon of the Colorado River, and a rocky mountainside, pointing out the geologic evidence of forces which continue to build up and wear away the surface of the earth.

results.title: How it happened
results.brief_description: Shows common risks and dangers telephone linesmen face resulting generally from negligence of correct safety procedures on their part or that of their fellow workers. A series of sequences provide examples of accidents brought about by one or more of the following basic causes: thoughtlessness, short cuts, poor job planning and arrangement, negligence of safety rules and over-confidence.
